original_solution_mapping.L1: After the accident, Mike can only type 65 words/minute - 20 words/minute = <<65-20=45>>45 words/minute.
original_solution_mapping.L2: So, he will be able to finish typing the document in 810 words / 45 words/minute = <<810/45=18>>18 minutes.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 600.
    Returns: the time it will take Mike to finish typing the document.
    """
    # L1
    initial_typing_speed = 65 # 65 words per minute
    speed_reduction = 20 # 20 words less per minute
    new_typing_speed = initial_typing_speed - speed_reduction

    # L2
    document_length = 810 # document with 810 words
    time_to_finish = document_length / new_typing_speed

    # FA
    answer = time_to_finish
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: After the accident, Mike can only type {initial_typing_speed} words/minute - {speed_reduction} words/minute = <<{initial_typing_speed}-{speed_reduction}={new_typing_speed}>>{new_typing_speed} words/minute.
So, he will be able to finish typing the document in {document_length} words / {new_typing_speed} words/minute = <<{document_length}/{new_typing_speed}={time_to_finish}>>{time_to_finish} minutes.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: After the accident, Mike can only type 65 words/minute - 20 words/minute = <<65-20=45>>45 words/minute.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: So, he will be able to finish typing the document in 45 words / 45 words/minute = <<45/45=1>>1 minutes.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'new_typing_speed' (45) was used instead of 'document_length' (810).
